author: Staff Reporter
text:
A private children’s home at Chengalpattu was shut down.

The decision was taken after it was found that the orphanage management had failed to obtain the necessary permission from the government to run such an institution.

Around sixty children — 35 boys and 25 girls — all below the age of thirteen, were shifted on Thursday to another private orphanage that is functioning in the Nandivaram-Guduvancheri area.

Enquiries reveal that a Chengalpattu-based individual started the orphanage on Kamarajar Salai in Melamaiyur, Chengalpattu, in the year 2010.

His repeated application for recognition was reportedly not entertained by the officials concerned in view of the fact that the land on which the buildings were raised was very close to a waterbody in the area.

However, the management of the orphanage continued with the service of providing shelter and education for the last five years.

Meanwhile, the District Administration received a tip-off that this institution was not recognised by the government.

Subsequently, officials made a surprise visit and shifted the children to the other orphanage. – Staff Reporter
title: Children’s home in Chengalpattu closed
